alert.note: Alert for Belmont; Guernsey; Harrison; Monroe; Noble (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:45PM EDT until March 23 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN HARRISON...EAST CENTRAL GUERNSEY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE...BELMONT AND NORTHEASTERN NOBLE COUNTIES... At 445 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Barnesville, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... St. Clairsville, Barnesville, Bethesda, Flushing, Quaker City, Belmont, Holloway, New Athens, Morristown, Neffs, Harrisville, and Salesville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
